Retrieving multiple resources using purrr

Source: vignettes/articles/multiple_resources_purrr.Rmd
multiple_resources_purrr.Rmd

It may be useful to retrieve multiple or all of the resources for a package. For example, the TTC Subway Delay Data is released monthly, with a new file each month.

library(opendatatoronto)

ttc_subway_delays_resources <- list_package_resources("https://open.toronto.ca/dataset/ttc-subway-delay-data/")

ttc_subway_delays_resources
#> # A tibble: 45 x 4
#>    name                         id                          format last_modified
#>    <chr>                        <chr>                       <chr>  <date>       
#>  1 ttc-subway-delay-codes       fece136b-224a-412a-b191-8d… XLSX   2019-08-15   
#>  2 ttc-subway-delay-jan-2014-a… 6664420f-316f-4f94-9ba4-d4… XLSX   2019-08-15   
#>  3 ttc-subway-delay-may-2017    d1159888-0035-45a0-b238-86… XLSX   2019-08-15   
#>  4 ttc-subway-delay-june-2017   240d8e8c-d300-4f91-b94f-cb… XLSX   2019-08-15   
#>  5 ttc-subway-delay-july-2017   98d4ac77-aa9f-40a3-97ee-6f… XLSX   2019-08-15   
#>  6 ttc-subway-delay-august-2017 92e7649a-cf2f-4ac7-9802-b7… XLSX   2019-08-15   
#>  7 ttc-subway-delay-september-… 61412f10-656b-4992-9a1a-a1… XLSX   2019-08-15   
#>  8 ttc-subway-delay-october-20… 69a6db37-7982-49c7-8dbc-56… XLSX   2019-08-15   
#>  9 ttc-subway-delay-november-2… 10080217-8022-41c0-a8ba-2a… XLSX   2019-08-15   
#> 10 ttc-subway-delay-december-2… a731c4bb-630a-4530-b590-b3… XLSX   2019-08-15   
#> # … with 35 more rows

It would be cumbersome to retrieve them one at a time, e.g. via

library(dplyr)

delays_jan_2019 <- ttc_subway_delays_resources %>%
  filter(name == "ttc-subway-delay-january-2019") %>%
  get_resource()

delays_feb_2019 <- ttc_subway_delays_resources %>%
  filter(name == "ttc-subway-delay-february-2019") %>%
  get_resource()

and so on.

Instead, you can iterate through the different resources using the purrr package and get them in a nested tibble:

library(purrr)

ttc_subway_delays_2019 <- ttc_subway_delays_resources %>%
  filter(grepl("2019", name)) %>%
  mutate(data = map(id, get_resource))

ttc_subway_delays_2019
#> # A tibble: 12 x 5
#>    name                 id                    format last_modified data         
#>    <chr>                <chr>                 <chr>  <date>        <list>       
#>  1 "ttc-subway-delay-j… 9a824dba-20cc-40b1-8… XLSX   2019-08-15    <tibble [1,8…
#>  2 "ttc-subway-delay-f… e6bac74e-2da2-4429-a… XLSX   2019-08-15    <tibble [1,5…
#>  3 "ttc-subway-delay-m… 0511879f-3233-4a42-8… XLSX   2019-08-15    <tibble [1,5…
#>  4 "ttc-subway-delay-a… 447b4a5a-f696-4f05-8… XLSX   2019-08-15    <tibble [1,5…
#>  5 "ttc-subway-delay-m… a302fcab-81a1-4142-b… XLSX   2019-08-15    <tibble [1,7…
#>  6 "ttc-subway-delay-j… 655a138c-d381-4fe7-b… XLSX   2019-08-15    <tibble [1,6…
#>  7 "ttc-subway-delay-J… 34d9619f-0239-4dad-a… XLSX   2019-10-07    <tibble [1,6…
#>  8 "ttc-subway-delay-A… b6557580-a0f4-4c96-9… XLSX   2019-10-07    <tibble [1,6…
#>  9 "ttc-subway-delay-S… e2a5e386-ddf7-4416-8… XLSX   2019-10-07    <tibble [1,5…
#> 10 "ttc-subway-delay-O… fd837bd2-85ed-485e-b… XLSX   2019-11-08    <tibble [1,4…
#> 11 "ttc-subway-delay-N… ac734fde-145d-4313-9… XLSX   2020-02-03    <tibble [1,4…
#> 12 "ttc-subway-delay-D… 967ea5f7-de10-4ca8-a… XLSX   2020-01-30    <tibble [1,5…

All of these resources contain equivalent data, with the same column names

map(ttc_subway_delays_2019[["data"]], colnames)
#> [[1]]
#>  [1] "Date"      "Time"      "Day"       "Station"   "Code"      "Min Delay"
#>  [7] "Min Gap"   "Bound"     "Line"      "Vehicle"  
#> 
#> [[2]]
#>  [1] "Date"      "Time"      "Day"       "Station"   "Code"      "Min Delay"
#>  [7] "Min Gap"   "Bound"     "Line"      "Vehicle"  
#> 
#> [[3]]
#>  [1] "Date"      "Time"      "Day"       "Station"   "Code"      "Min Delay"
#>  [7] "Min Gap"   "Bound"     "Line"      "Vehicle"  
#> 
#> [[4]]
#>  [1] "Date"      "Time"      "Day"       "Station"   "Code"      "Min Delay"
#>  [7] "Min Gap"   "Bound"     "Line"      "Vehicle"  
#> 
#> [[5]]
#>  [1] "Date"      "Time"      "Day"       "Station"   "Code"      "Min Delay"
#>  [7] "Min Gap"   "Bound"     "Line"      "Vehicle"  
#> 
#> [[6]]
#>  [1] "Date"      "Time"      "Day"       "Station"   "Code"      "Min Delay"
#>  [7] "Min Gap"   "Bound"     "Line"      "Vehicle"  
#> 
#> [[7]]
#>  [1] "Date"      "Time"      "Day"       "Station"   "Code"      "Min Delay"
#>  [7] "Min Gap"   "Bound"     "Line"      "Vehicle"  
#> 
#> [[8]]

#>  [7] "Min Gap"   "Bound"     "Line"      "Vehicle"

#>  [1] "Date"      "Time"      "Day"       "Station"   "Code"      "Min Delay"
#>  [7] "Min Gap"   "Bound"     "Line"      "Vehicle"  
#>

#>  [1] "Date"      "Time"      "Day"       "Station"   "Code"      "Min Delay"
#>  [7] "Min Gap"   "Bound"     "Line"      "Vehicle"

#> [[11]]
#>  [1] "Date"      "Time"      "Day"       "Station"   "Code"      "Min Delay"
#>  [7] "Min Gap"   "Bound"     "Line"      "Vehicle"  
#> 
#> [[12]]
#>  [1] "Date"      "Time"      "Day"       "Station"   "Code"      "Min Delay"
#>  [7] "Min Gap"   "Bound"     "Line"      "Vehicle"

so the data can easily be unnested and combined:

bind_rows(ttc_subway_delays_2019[["data"]])
#> # A tibble: 19,222 x 10
#>    Date                Time  Day   Station Code  `Min Delay` `Min Gap` Bound
#>    <dttm>              <chr> <chr> <chr>   <chr>       <dbl>     <dbl> <chr>
#>  1 2019-01-01 00:00:00 01:08 Tues… YORK M… PUSI            0         0 S    
#>  2 2019-01-01 00:00:00 02:14 Tues… ST AND… PUMST           0         0 <NA> 
#>  3 2019-01-01 00:00:00 02:16 Tues… JANE S… TUSC            0         0 W    
#>  4 2019-01-01 00:00:00 02:27 Tues… BLOOR … SUO             0         0 N    
#>  5 2019-01-01 00:00:00 03:03 Tues… DUPONT… MUATC          11        16 N    
#>  6 2019-01-01 00:00:00 03:08 Tues… EGLINT… EUATC          11        16 S    
#>  7 2019-01-01 00:00:00 03:09 Tues… DUPONT… EUATC           6        11 N    
#>  8 2019-01-01 00:00:00 03:26 Tues… ST CLA… EUATC           4         9 N    
#>  9 2019-01-01 00:00:00 03:37 Tues… KENNED… TUMVS           0         0 E    
#> 10 2019-01-01 00:00:00 08:04 Tues… DAVISV… MUNOA           5        10 S    
#> # … with 19,212 more rows, and 2 more variables: Line <chr>, Vehicle <dbl>
